item.title: Chenopodium berlandieri. Lamb's quarters. Goosefoot. One of the most prolific native plants in
item.description: Chenopodium berlandieri. Lamb's quarters. Goosefoot. One of the most prolific native plants in North America, now best known as a nuisance weed and wayward cousin of the miracle health food quinoa (Chenopodium quinoa).

item.title: Before Maize, Relative of Quinoa Fed Ohio Valley 3,000 Years Ago
item.description:
Before Maize, Relative of Quinoa Fed Ohio Valley 3,000 Years Ago

By Cameron Fortin '16 On a brisk autumn morning, Ohio University students, staff, faculty, and supporters enthusiastically met at the research gardens on West State Street to harvest a plant viewed by most Ohioans as a weed. It fed Ohio Valley residents more than 3,000 years ago, and it has ...
